intro: Cyrbasium, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Cyrbasium has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
